question_details.query: What are the long-term effects of using municipal waste compost on soil fertility over a 20-year period?

summary_details.relevant_summary: Two controlled, replicated trials (Spain and the United Kingdom) measured effects of adding municipal compost or wastes to soil; one trial found that adding municipal compost to semi-arid soils greatly reduced soil loss and water runoff, while another reported mixed results when adding composts and wastes [890]. Soil types covered by these studies were coarse loamy and sandy loam [890].
summary_statements: Two controlled, replicated trials in Spain and the United Kingdom measured the effects of adding municipal compost or wastes to soil.
One trial found that adding municipal compost to semi-arid soils greatly reduced soil loss and water runoff.
Another trial reported mixed results when adding composts and wastes.
Soil types covered by studies on municipal compost were coarse loamy and sandy loam.
